Smart cameras to detect errant drivers.description: NOIDA: The city may soon undertake a pilot project for four months in which an artificial intelligence based Integrated Traffic Management System (ITMS) will be launched by installing cameras that will automatically capture images and issue challans in case of traffic violation. The project was discussed at the district road safety committee meeting that took place on Saturday evening. A Pune-based private company spoke about the new system at the meeting. During a meeting on Friday, chief minister Yogi Adityanath had asked the authorities of all three cities, Noida, Greater Noida and Yeida City, to be developed as smart cities with ITMS to manage traffic. “We will be writing to the state government seeking an increase in road safety funds for Gautam Budh Nagar, considering a huge increase in population, vehicles and traffic in the past few years. We have taken many steps recently that also require support,” said B N Singh, the district magistrate. Officials said road safety week will be observed between June 17 and 22 and awareness drives, workshops and a bike rally would be held. Noida Authority official Rajeev Tyagi has been made the nodal officer with regards to increasing awareness about road safety by integrating the campaign with Raahgiri and other events. Enforcement at various important intersections was also discussed and officials said there was greater need for increasing awareness regarding the increased traffic penalties across the state. “We will soon get around 400 traffic police personnel to offset the serious staff shortage,” said Singh. Earlier, officials had identified 35 black spots across the district and will now suggest corrective steps for them. “The DM especially focused on the black spots along the expressway. We will be writing to the departments to suggest solutions within a week. The Noida-Greater Noida Expressway is a ‘no tolerance zone’ now and we will not let buses or even cabs pick and drop passengers. If they do, the permits would be cancelled,” said Himesh Tiwary, the assistant regional transport officer. Other issues discussed at the meeting included target-based campaign against unauthorised autos and e-rickshaws, continuation of the “no helmet, no fuel” drive at petrol pumps and other places, awareness drives regarding location of ambulances and facilities available for EWS category patients in case of road accidents. Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" Now buses for Haridwar from Greater Noid.description: GREATER NOIDA: Given the ensuing 'Char Dham Yatra' of religious pilgramges to holy shrines, part of which - Kedarnath, Badrinath - fall in Uttarakhand region and increased demands from residents in Greater Noida, Muzaffarnagar, Meerut and Roorkee, the UP State Road Transport Corporation (UPSRTC) has started daily bus service from Greater Noida depot to Haridwar on Friday. The buses will ply twice a day - 5:30am (with actual departure time at 6am) from Greater Noida depot via Alpha commercial metro station in Greater Noida and again at 7pm. The fare from Greater Noida depot is Rs 279 and from Alpha commercial metro station is Rs 275. "There was increasing demand for the bus service to Haridwar from residents of Greater Noida especially those belonging to Uttarakhand. So we have provided this facility which will benefit residents of not only Noida and Greater Noida, but also Ghaziabad, Meerut, Roorkie etc," Luv Kumar assistant regional manager (ARM) Greater Noida depot, Gautam Budh Nagar UPSRTC told TOI. According to Kumar, the route of the bus with capacity of 52 passengers per trip will include Noida via Greater Noida, Ghaziabad, Modinagar, Meerut, Muradnagar, Khatauli, Muzaffarnagar, UP border, Roorkee, Jwalapur to Haridwar. Kumar further maintained that the number of buses might be increased depending on the demand. "We have started with services twice a day - morning and evening. But these can be increased if there is demand for the same," said Kumar. JPS Rawat, president Uttarakhand cultural committee, maintained that there are many residents from Uttarakhand residing in Greater Noida. "Besides it is a requirement for all residents and will benefit the district in the long run," said Rawat. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Noida: In multi-crore scam probe, a tuss.description: NOIDA: A black Mercedes parked at Sector 20 police station for the past two years has become a bone of contention between a company accused of multi-crore fraud through Ponzi schemes and the CBI. The car is owned by Webwork Trade Links Pvt Ltd, which has allegedly duped over 40,000 people of Rs 125 crore. The car is rusting at the police station since the two main accused — Anurag Garg and Sandesh Verma, who served as directors in Webwork Trade Links — were arrested in February 2017. Garg has now moved a Ghaziabad court, demanding that the car be released from the custody of CBI. Garg and Verma are out on bail. In his application to the special judicial magistrate, Ghaziabad, on April 22, Garg has claimed the car (UK07BX8000) was seized by GB Nagar police in the case lodged at the Sector 20 police station against the two directors. “Since the CBI is probing the case as per the directions of the Allahabad high court, the CBI has kept the car in its custody. The car is getting damaged due to being parked at the police station and its fitness is getting affected,” reads the application. The accused has given an undertaking that he won’t make changes in the make-up of the car and not sell it to anyone. However, in its response, the anti-corruption branch of CBI, Ghaziabad, has urged the court that the application for the release of car be dismissed. The investigation officer of the case, KS Lohchab, has said that “Sandesh Verma is not cooperating with the probe” and he had not reported to CBI in compliance of the notices issued. “The authenticity of the authorisation filed by the applicant on behalf of accused Sandesh Verma is appearing to be suspicious. The car has been purchased by the accused directors of Webwork Trade Links Pvt Ltd by using the fund of the company... the car may not be allowed to be released till completion of investigation,” reads the CBI response. The CBI has also filed an application for Verma’s bail cancellation at Allahabad HC. The next date of hearing in the case is July 24. When contacted, a spokesperson for CBI said the case is currently under investigation. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Buses from Gr Noida for char dham yatra.description: Greater Noida: The UP State Road Transport Corporation (UPSRTC) has started a daily bus service from its Greater Noida depot to Haridwar in the wake of the char dham yatra. Part of the yatra — Kedarnath and Badrinath — falls in Uttarakhand. The buses will ply twice a day — 5.30am from Greater Noida depot via Alpha commercial metro station and again at 7pm. Officials said the fare from Greater Noida depot will be Rs 279 for Haridwar and Rs 275 from Alpha commercial metro station. “Residents of Greater Noida and those from Uttarakhand have long been demanding a bus service to Haridwar. So, we decided to provide this facility, which will benefit residents of not only Noida and Greater Noida, but also Ghaziabad, Meerut, Roorkie etc,” said Luv Kumar, assistant regional manager of UPSRTC’s Greater Noida depot. According to Kumar, the route of the bus, which can carry up to 52 passengers a trip, will include Greater Noida, Ghaziabad, Modinagar, Meerut, Muradnagar, Khatauli, Muzaffarnagar and Roorkee. Kumar further maintained that the number of buses might be increased, depending on the demand. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. In Video:Actress Urmila Matondkar meets Rahul Gandhi, joins CongressDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Couple in row with builder booked for fi.description: GREATER NOIDA: A couple have been booked for allegedly setting a fire alarm ablaze in their housing society in Noida Extension last week. The FIR against Gaurav Gupta, an IT professional, and his wife Tripti was registered on a complaint by the builder, Saya Buildcon. The couple denied the allegations and said the complaint had been filed to stop residents from raising civic issues at the society, Saya Zion. According to the complaint filed by Shivendra Sharma, DGM (projects) of Saya Buildcon, the incident took place on June 11 on the 7th-floor flat of Tower I outside the flat of the Guptas. “Around 11am, the maintenance department was informed that the fire alarm on the 7th floor had caught fire. The guards responded to the call, and doused the fire. The accused couple, who live on the same floor, alleged negligence and created an issue in the residential society,” said Sharma. He added that an internal investigation was carried out. “Our team found out that the fire alarm uses 24V DC current to operate and there is no possibility of a short circuit which can lead to fire,” Sharma wrote in the complaint. According to Sharma, 16 other alarms installed in the tower were damaged and their repairs would cost the builder Rs 20,000. “The couple caused us monetary loss and fought with the maintenance staff too,” Sharma said. Gaurav denied the allegations and said he was in hospital while his wife was about to leave for office when she spotted the fire. He said he was being targeted because he had been continuously raising security and other maintenance issues at the society. “The society lacks major security flaws like CCTV cameras on the floors and the maintenance is poor. I got possession of my flat in 2018 and have been vocal since the beginning. I feel I am being deliberately targeted,” he said. An FIR has been registered against the couple under sections 323(causing hurt), 427 (causing damage to the amount of Rs 50), 434 (voluntarily causing hurt) and 504 (intentional Insult) of the IPC. Botanical parking among big projects nea.description: NOIDA: The Noida Authority is all set to complete 12 large infrastructure projects worth Rs 1,502 crore in the current financial year, officials said. The district hospital, five multilevel parking lots, a biodiversity park in Sector 91, a multi-purpose indoor stadium, a shooting range and a bus depot are some of the projects that are likely to be opened soon. The bridge across Shahdara drain, between Sectors 14 and 14A, would be ready this month — the first of the 12 projects to be completed. “The bridge, costing about Rs 6 crore, is almost ready and can be opened by June. We are conducting regular inspections of the district hospital and the parking lots to ensure they are ready on time,” said Rajeev Tyagi, general manager, Noida Authority. The district hospital in Sector 39 is being built at a cost of Rs 346 crore and is expected to be inaugurated by October 1. Multilevel parking lots at sectors 5 and 38A, near Botanical Garden, are expected to be ready by August. The parking lot in Sector 38A is the costliest of the 12 projects. Being built at a cost of Rs 577 crore, it can accommodate around 7,000 cars and can also be used as a bus parking area to reduce congestion near Botanical Garden metro station. An underground car parking lot at Sector 16A, near Film City, will be ready by October and two others at sectors 1 and 3 are likely to be ready by December. The bus depot at Sector 82 will be ready by March, officials said. Shaheed Bhagar Singh Park in Sector 150, costing Rs 28 crore, and the biodiversity park in Sector 91, costing Rs 42 crore, are expected to be ready by the end of this year. “But before an official inauguration, we hope to plant more trees and increase foliage and greenery in these parks, which may take till December,” said Tyagi. In the 2017-18 fiscal, the Authority had finished pending projects worth Rs 1,200 crore. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

'Disclose fees on website or pay Rs 5 la.description: NOIDA: The district fee regulation committee (DFRC) of Gautam Budh Nagar on Sunday said schools that were pulled up on Saturday for failing to disclose fee structures on their websites will be fined Rs 5 lakh for repeat violation if they do not do the same by July, when the next meeting is scheduled. “All schools, which have been asked to roll back the increased fee, would also have to comply and submit the details of compliance before DFRC’s July meeting, else they too would face compounded fines,” P K Upadhay, the district inspector of schools, said. On Saturday, a total fine of Rs 8.30 lakh had been imposed on 17 schools in the district for violating various provisions of the Uttar Pradesh Fee Regulation Act (2018). This is the last month for the schools to correct transgressions of the Act (2018), Upadhyay said. “On Saturday, we fined 17 schools. Thirty-one of them were initially served notices. We now expect all schools to comply with the rules,” Upadhay added. Eight schools that were fined Rs 75,000 each are — CLM Public School, Gagan Public School, Grads International School, Greater Heights Public School, Shri Ravi Shankar Vidya Mandir, SD Public School, Karl Huber School and Dharam Public School. The UP Fee Regulation Act, which was introduced as an ordinance a year ago, was imposed as an Act in October 2018. The schools were asked to correct their fee structure as per the Act by adjusting increments while using the year 2016-17 as the base year. However, complaints continued to pour in from parents soon after the schools reopened for the 2019-20 session with some of them reporting hikes over 10 percent. OPDs wear deserted look in Noida, govern.description: NOIDA: Health services were crippled across Noida on Monday as most doctors in private hospitals and clinics refrained from work in support of the strike call given by the Indian Medical Association (IMA) to protest the violence against medical practitioners in Bengal. The three government hospitals in the city stayed opened for both OPDs and emergency services, but doctors there wore black bands to support the nationwide strike call. Most OPDs in private hospitals wore a deserted look as patients had prior information about the strike. Some, however, had to return without treatment. OPD services were shut in almost all private hospitals, such as Fortis, Kailash, Metro multi-speciality, Metro heart institute, etc. There were reports of some doctors functioning in Kailash hospital, Noida, but officials said they were totally in support of the strike call by IMA. Some had pamphlets supporting the strike pasted on main doors. A pamphlet stuck on the glass door of Metro multi-speciality hospital in Sector 11 read: “National medical strike, no more violence, we declare zero tolerance.” Chanchal, a visitor to the hospital, told TOI that only emergency services were being delivered. A statement from Fortis said the hospital had closed down OPDs and non-essential services on Monday “to express their concern about the repeated acts of violence against doctors and other care givers recently at the Kolkata’s NRS Medical College”. \u2018I don\u2019t watch cricket but an.description: After the US Ice Hockey team upset the mighty Soviet team in the semi-final of the 1980 Winter Olympics, a sports magazine ran a cover story featuring a picture of the American players celebrating without any explanatory captions or headline. “It didn’t need it. Everyone in America knew what happened,” explained the photographer. It’s not as if ice hockey was a popular game in the US but such was the hype for the game – played at the height of the Cold War – that even Americans who had never watched ice hockey before or didn’t even know the rules tuned in for it. Many Indians would find this scenario familiar. Because today, they will do the same as India and Pakistan face off in an epic Cricket World Cup game (unless the rain has other plans). Cricket might be a religion in India, but there still are plenty of atheists around, many of whom don’t even understand cricket, let alone follow it. And they only end their aversion to the game on one particular occasion – when India plays Pakistan. The reasons range from peer pressure to a heightened sense of patriotism and even adherence to social decorum. ‘Cricket-crazy family leaves me no choice’Vamini Sethi, management consultant, 33, GurgaonI will watch the game as my cricket-crazy family will leave me with no choice. It will be on TV all day and all the discussions in the house will be about the match. I don’t follow cricket because I find it too time-consuming and overhyped. There are other sports like hockey, kabaddi that bring glory to our country but go unnoticed. I have nothing against the game; it brings the entire nation together. But it has so many fans, I’m sure it can do with one less. ‘Don’t usually have time to watch cricket, but will make time today’Ashvarya Sharma, homemaker, 52, DelhiIt’s not that I hate cricket but since I am a homemaker, I have to keep running around doing chores and can’t spend the whole day sitting and watching cricket. But TV pe bhi toh wahi chalta hai din bhar toh dekhna hi padta hai. However, the India-Pakistan game is different. I watch it by choice. It’s not just cricket; it’s almost war-like. The sentiment is different. In fact, today I plan to finish my chores early. Kitchen ki bhi chutti hai uss din. I don't miss a single ball of any India-Pakistan match. ‘Will watch the match because it is the patriotic thing to do’Ananya Pandey, communication professional, 29, DelhiI really never had anyone in my family who was an ardent cricket fan or watched it for fun, so I never found any company to watch the game or develop a taste for it. The last game I watched was the 2011 World Cup final that India won. I watched because it was a special occasion and it felt like the patriotic thing to do. Similarly, I will watch the India-Pakistan match today because it’s a different rush altogether. As clichéd as it may sound, as an Indian, any Indo-Pak discussion catches my attention. Specially post the Pulwama attack and the increasing political tensions, I’d like to see how this tension will affect the performances of both the teams. Also, on a lighter note, my boss – a die-hard cricket fan – has instructed me to watch this match and cheer for India. 'After balakot strike, anything India-Pak will attract me'Rajat Kothari, banker, 38, NoidaI don’t follow cricket but an India-Pakistan game is not cricket. I don’t understand the rules and the jargon of cricket and prefer football, to be honest. At least, it’s played by more than a dozen countries in the world. But when I will sit with my friends and family to watch the game today, I won’t be watching cricket, I feel I will be supporting India against Pakistan, on all fronts. After the skirmishes recently and the Balakot Air Strike, the atmosphere is such that anything India-Pakistan will attract my attention. This will be my first ever cricket match and I hope India wins. ‘The only way to socialise today’Ishita Mathur, teacher, 22, GhaziabadI will watch it because it’s a great way to socialise. Today, cricket will be the only topic of conversation. It just doesn’t seem right to ignore that or not be a part of the discourse. So, I will join my family in front of the TV today and watch the game. The reason I don’t watch cricket is because I find it boring. I prefer other team sports like football and basketball. They seem more participative and active. In cricket, it seems only the bowler and batsmen are doing something at a given time while the others are passively involved. 'Flatmates will suck me into the frenzy'Tsering Tashi, research scholar, 29, DelhiI will have to watch it. What else do you do when everyone around you is crazy about it? I live in a flat with three other cricket-crazy boys and they will watch the game. So, I will be party to the frenzy. I grew up watching and playing football and for me, that is the beautiful game. Cricket is just a colonial hangover, not a sport. I have managed to avoid all the other India matches in the World Cup so far but the hype around the India-Pakistan match is such that you get sucked into the maelstrom somehow. Match tickets being sold for Rs 4 lakhThe tickets for the clash which will take place at the Old Trafford Stadium – which has a capacity of 20000 – were sold out within hours of the ticket window opening. There were half a million ticket applications for the match, meaning the stadium could have been sold out 20 times over. And now, those who have bought the tickets are earning more by re-selling them. One website, is now buying tickets from fans and is reselling them for prices ranging from approximately Rs 20,000 to Rs 60,000. According to the UK media, tickets are being sold in the black market for anything from £5,000 (Rs 4.4 lakh) to £2,500 (Rs 2.2 lakh) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Greater Noida: Child on worker\u2019s ba.description: GREATER NOIDA: A three-year-old girl tied to her mother’s back died while her parents were injured when the walls of a ditch that was being dug at a construction site collapsed on them in Greater Noida on Tuesday. Workers at the site said the two private contractors overseeing the construction had forced them to get into the ditch despite the soil being loose. Angoori (24), a construction worker, took along her three-year-old child, Monika, with her into the ditch as there was no one to look after her. Angoori, her husband Guddu (25) and Monika were all trapped under the soil along with two other labourers — Babulal (35) and Bari (55). The cave-in took place at the construction site of a private building in Knowledge Park area around 11.45am. An excavator had just dug a ditch to lay the foundation for the building when the two contractors — Lalit and Kapil Bhadana — asked six of their workers to get inside the 6ft ditch and level the walls manually. As both Angoori and Guddu were ordered to get inside, they could not have left Monika alone. “Minutes before the accident, an earthmover had dug up the area. After this, the contractors asked a bunch of workers to get inside the ditch and level the walls. This seemed risky, but the contractors forced the workers,” said Rajkumar, Angoori’s brother. He said the workers had told the two contractors that the soil was loose, but they refused to budge. “There was a pile of debris that needed to be excavated, but the contractor, without realising the odds, forced the workers inside the ditch. The walls collapsed within minutes and fell on the workers. The adults survived, but Monika succumbed to her injuries. My sister and brother-in-law, too, suffered injuries in the head and chest,” Rajkumar added. The victims were rushed to Sharda Hospital, where the child was declared dead on arrival, while others were admitted for treatment of injuries. The two contractors have been booked under sections 304A (causing death by negligence) on a complaint by Rajkumar. “The contractors — Lalit and Kapil Bhadana — fled the spot soon after the accident. Prima facie, the construction workers were not given any helmets before they were sent inside the drain. A probe has been initiated, and due action will be taken against those found guilty,” said Arvind Pathak, the station house officer of Knowledge Park police station. Asked about the condition of the other workers, the officer said one of them, Bari, was being treated for critical injuries. “Most of them have been discharged after first-aid. A woman named Bari is still in the ICU for critical head injuries,” Pathak added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Seven held in Noida farmhouse for raping.description: NOIDA: Seven persons have been arrested for allegedly raping three Delhi-based women at a farmhouse in Noida’s Sector 135 area, close to the venue of a pool party from where 192 youngsters were arrested last month. The women, who police said were sex workers, had been brought to Noida by two of the accused, but they were later joined by seven others, who forced themselves on to the women against their wish. Seven of the men were arrested from HPS farmhouse area in Chhaprauli village. Police said the farmhouse belongs to an official in Delhi’s transport department, Panchpal Singh. One of the arrested men, Lovkesh Yadav, works as a security guard at the farmhouse, which was sealed by the police under Section 102 of the CrPC. The women lodged a complaint at Expressway police station on Wednesday morning, alleging that around 11.30 pm on Tuesday, they were standing near Lajpat Nagar metro station when two men arrived in a cab — a white Swift Dzire (DL1ZC0576). “The women told police that they reached an agreement for Rs 9,000,” Gautam Budh Nagar SSP Vaibhav Krishna said. The men apparently told the women they would take them to Sector 18 and handed over an advance of Rs 3,600, but instead took them to the HPS farmhouse in Sector 135. There, seven people joined them, which was not part of the deal, police said. “Seeing nine men, the women raised objection and asked the men to leave them back to Delhi. However, the accused men forcibly had sex with them,” the SSP said.After much pleading, one of the accused left the women on Pusta road on a bike, after which they approached the cops. Based o the complaint, an FIR was lodged against the accused men under IPC sections 376(d) and 323. A team from the Expressway police station raided the farmhouse and arrested seven of the accused — Akhilesh Yadav, Lovkesh Yadav, Bhola Yadav, Anjan Yadav, Rajesh Yadav, Satish Pal and Rajkumar Maurya. Bank shared account statement without co.description: GREATER NOIDA: A Delhi Police constable has accused a private bank official of unlawfully sharing her bank account statement with another person, without her permission. In a complaint filed at Sector 49 police station, Nisha said she came to know from her home branch at Asaf Ali Road in Delhi that a bank official at Noida’s Sector 51 branch took out a statement of her one year’s transaction without her knowledge. “In April, I received a message from the bank that mentioned Rs 300 was deducted from my account. I had immediately called up the customer care and learnt the money was deducted as a fee for obtaining a year’s account statement. When I told the representative that it was not me, he asked me to contact my home branch,” said Nisha. “Later I came to know from my home branch the statement was taken out by an official of Noida’s Sector 51 branch,” she added. Nisha claimed the Noida police are not registering an FIR in the case even after one and a half months of her complaint. “A probe is underway. We’ve asked the bank to give details on how the private information was leaked without permission. An FIR will be filed only after the preliminary probe is complete,” said Ajay Kumar Aggarwal, SHO of Sector 49 police station. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

13km DND corridor to transport live hear.description: NOIDA: A ‘live’ heart was transported from one private hospital in Noida to another in Delhi through a green corridor that was created on Sunday night, officials said on Monday. The city traffic police created a 13-kilometre-long green corridor via the DND Flyway and the organ was transported in eight minutes and thirty seconds. Superintendent of police (traffic) Anil Jha said that around 6 pm on Sunday, Noida’s Fortis Hospital in Sector 62 informed police that a heart was to be transported to Delhi’s Max hospital. He said that doctors were of the view thatthe receiver of the organ should get it as soon as possible. Officer Jha said that after the information was received, they started preparing traffic control and personnel were deployed on the stretch between Sector 62 and DND Flyway. The heart left the hospital around 9.38pm and reached the DND Flyway. After this, the Delhi traffic police took over and transported the vital organ safely to the hospital in Saket. Traffic officers said that the heart was successfully transplanted to the patient at the Delhi hospital. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

UP: No bail yet for channel staff in Yog.description: GREATER NOIDA: A local court on Tuesday reserved its order while hearing the bail pleas of three TV news channel staffers who were arrested on June 8. The three have been booked in two FIRs, one for a debate that the channel aired on June 6 that was deemed defamatory to chief minister Yogi Adityanath and another for the channel allegedly running without the requisite permits. Tuesday’s bail hearing in the court of the additional sessions judge of Surajpur court was related to charges of defamation against the trio. The hearing in the other FIR, in which the police have invoked charges of cheating and forgery, may take place on Wednesday. KK Singh, who represents one of the staffers, Ishika Singh, said the court of the additional district and sessions judge Nalin Kant Tyagi had reserved its order for Wednesday while hearing the first (defamation) case. The bail pleas of Ishika and Shukla were rejected by a lower court last week. Parth Upadhayay, the lawyer representing anchor Anshul Kaushik and editor Anuj Shukla, said they had argued vehemently against the allegations levelled by police. Greater Noida: Man abandons wife, leaves.description: GREATER NOIDA: A 25-year-old man left behind his wife and two children at his in-laws’ place and walked out with his 13-year-old sister-in-law, purportedly to marry her. The man, along with two uncles and a friend, has been booked for confining the minor girl. The woman’s father Hanif, a resident of Greater Noida, had filed a police complaint claiming that his son-in-law Allah Mehar had come over for Eid on June 7. “I was leaving for work when my son-in-law came with my daughter, two grandchildren and three of his relatives. When I came back from my shift, my daughter told me he had taken her younger sister along with him,” said Hanif, adding that the accused also took away Rs 70,000 in cash and jewellery kept in the house. Hanif said the next day, he went to Mehar’s house in Bulandshahr and requested him to free his younger daughter. “I requested him to let my daughter go because she is a minor and should not be forced into marriage. But he threatened me that he would get my family killed if I ever came back to see my daughter. He has been keeping her hostage for the past 10 days. I have sought police’s support,” said Hanif. Officers at Greater Noida police station registered an FIR on Sunday against Mehar (25), his uncles Tarikhat (30) and Bhoora (25), along with Nanhe (25), all residents of Bulandshahr, under sections 363 (kidnapping), 366 (abducting or inducing woman to compel her marriage), 506 (criminal intimidation) of the IPC. “The accused is absconding with the minor girl. We have reprimanded his relatives, arrests will be made soon,” said Sujeet Upadhyay, the SHO of Greater Noida police station. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Ghaziabad gang that used app to book cab.description: GREATER NOIDA: Police on Saturday nabbed three persons for booking cabs via mobile apps and allegedly robbing three drivers at gunpoint in one week. The police said that the accused allegedly used mobile phones of their victims to book cabs for their next targets. The accused have been identified as Deepak (23), a resident of Dankaur, and Anurag (23) and Badal (22) from Vijay Nagar in Ghaziabad. According to the police, the accused carried out the robberies in Bisrakh, Surajpur and near Greater Noida police station within a week. “They booked all the cabs from Vijay nagar to reach Greater Noida and used mobiles stolen from the drivers,” said Vaibhav Krishna, SSP, Gautam Budh Nagar. On May 30, the gang booked a Swift Dzire from Vijay Nagar. Before reaching Bisrakh, the assailants took over the vehicle from the driver, Gautam. “They pushed me to the back seat and also tied my hands and legs. They were taking the car to a secluded area, but it ran out of fuel. They took Rs 4,000 cash, my phone and car keys from me and fled leaving the car behind,” said Gautam in his complaint lodged at Bisrakh police station. The accused men used mobile phone to book another cab on June 5. After boarding the Tata Zest from Vijay Nagar the assailants snatched it from the driver near Tilpata roundabout. “The accused took the car along with cash and the driver’s mobile phone. An FIR was registered in Surajpur police station,” said Krishna. The third robbery occurred two days later, when a cab driver named Virendra Singh filed a complaint alleging that he was robbed of his IndigoCS by three men near Sirsa roundabout. Police said they observed a pattern in the three robberies and realised that all of them were conducted by the same gang. “We nabbed them near Roja Jalalpur roundabout on Saturday morning. The accused confessed to the crime. We recovered six mobile phones, a purse, two Aadhaar cards, a PAN card, and two vehicles from their possession,” said Krishna. The officer further added that the mastermind of the gang was Deepak, who was wanted in a dozen cases of robbery and was released from jail a month ago.
